meanings.definition: The quality or fact of being late or delayed.
meanings.sent1: Her constant tardiness to work caused her to miss important meetings.
meanings.sent2: The teacher marked him down for his frequent tardiness in submitting assignments.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his tardiness to the party made him miss the cake cutting.
meanings.sent4: The tardiness of the train turned his quick journey into a long, frustrating wait.
meanings.sent5: The tardiness of the sunrise painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.

meanings.sent1: His tardiness became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent2: She tried to break the cycle of tardiness by setting multiple alarms.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tardiness in catching the mouse led to a comical chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: The tardiness of the flowers blooming in winter puzzled the botanist.
meanings.sent5: The tardiness of the bus driver left the passengers waiting in the rain.
